text:
Blake Shelton and Kelly Clarkson once made Adam Levine cry when they took some teasing too far.

The three music stars currently work as coaches on U.S. TV singing show The Voice alongside Alicia Keys, but they’ve actually all been pals for many years.

While Blake, Kelly and Adam aren’t afraid to engage in some good-natured banter onscreen,the country musician recalled during an appearance on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon on Monday night a time when they got carried away with shenanigans after they watched Adam perform with his band Maroon 5 at a gig in Oklahoma several years ago.

“We had a designated driver because it was New Year’s Eve and we were drinking,” Blake said. “So, we went to his show, made fun of him, and when he got done, he came to stay at my house. And on the way back to the casino from my place, we got pulled over, we were in like a van, and we got pulled over by a deputy sheriff.”

Blake then explained that he and Kelly immediately launched into giving the cop a hard time. However, their behaviour stunned Adam, who was seriously concerned about their antics.

“Not that we don’t respect the police but we knew we hadn’t done anything wrong and so you can be a little cocky at that point,” the 41-year-old smiled. “And Adam didn’t see it that way because Adam’s from Los Angeles where you don’t talk back to the police. And in Oklahoma, if you’ve got a good point – you do sometimes. Especially Kelly, she was ribbing this guy (who) had a moustache that wasn’t cool looking. And Adam was convinced we were going to jail and he got upset. I’ll never forget it, (he was saying), ‘Kelly shut up, Kelly shut up.’ It got intense.”
